page.title: 02KIRBY HILL
page.content: A village of about 20 houses surrounding a village green with the church of St Peter and St Felix dominating one side. The village is a cul de sac with only one entrance from the main road which runs close by. The village has a preservation order on it as have most of the houses. Grammar School House, next to the church, was built in 1556 as a day school for local boys, two floors of the house were left for the aged of the parish. A house for the schoolmater was incorporated into the building. The house is now divided into two parts,one half being let out as a private dwelling, the other half rented as a holiday home. The schoolroom is now used as a village hall.
